Name: ABERCROMBIE, Neil
Bio:
['a Representative from Hawaii; born in Buffalo, Erie County, N.Y., \r', 'June 26, 1938; graduated from Williamsville High School, Williamsville, N.Y.; \r', 'B.A., Union College, Schenectady, N.Y., 1959; M.A., University of Hawaii, \r', 'Manoa, Hawaii, 1964; Ph.D., University of Hawaii, Manoa, Hawaii, 1974; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for United States Senate in 1970; member of the Hawaii \r', 'state house of representatives, 1974-1978; member of the Hawaii state senate, \r', '1978-1986; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-ninth Congress in a special \r', 'election to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States \r', 'Representative Cecil Heftel (September 20, 1986-January 3, 1987); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to the One Hundredth Congress in 1986; member of the \r', 'Honolulu city council, 1988-1991; elected to the One Hundred Second and to the \r', 'nine succeeding Congresses until his resignation on February 28, 2010 (January \r', '3, 1991-February 28, 2010); Governor of Hawaii, 2010-2014. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Abercrombie, Neil, and Richard Hoyt. \r', 'Blood of Patriots. New York: Forge, 1996; Abercrombie, Neil. \r', '”Mumford, Mailer, and Machines: Staking a Claim for Man.” Ph. D. Diss., \r', 'University of Hawaii, 1974.\r']

Name: ACKERMAN, Gary Leonard
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Brooklyn, Kings County, N.Y., November 19, 1942; graduated from Brooklyn Technical High School, Brooklyn, N.Y., 1960; B.A., Queens College, Flushing, N.Y., 1965; attended, St. John’s University, Jamaica, N.Y., 1966; teacher; member of the New York state senate, 1979-1983; business owner; unsuccessful candidate for city council, New York City, N.Y., 1977; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Benjamin Rosenthal, and reelected to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (March 1, 1983-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: ADERHOLT, Robert
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Haleyville, Winston County, \r', 'Ala., July 22, 1965; B.A., Birmingham Southern College, Birmingham, Ala., 1987; \r', 'J.D., Samford University, Birmingham, Ala., 1990; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'Haleyville, Ala., municipal judge, 1992-1995; staff, Alabama Governor Fob \r', 'James, 1995-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the \r', 'ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: ADLER, John H.
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Philadelphia, Philadelphia \r', 'County, Pa., August 23, 1959; B.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1981; \r', 'J.D., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1984; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'member, Cherry Hill (N.J.) township council, 1987-1991; New Jersey state \r', 'senate, 1991-2008; unsuccessful candidate for United States House of \r', 'Representatives in 1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; died on April 4, 2011, \r', 'in Philadelphia, Pa.\r']

Name: AKIN, W. Todd
Bio: [' a Representative from Missouri; born in New York, N.Y., July 5, \r', '1947; B.S., Worcester Polytechnic Institute, Worcester, Mass., 1971; M.Div., \r', 'Covenant Seminary, St. Louis, Mo., 1984; United States Army, 1971-1980; member \r', 'of the Missouri state house of representatives, 1988-2001; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012, but was an unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election to the United States Senate. \r']

Name: ALEXANDER, Rodney
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana; born in Quitman, Jackson Parish, \r', 'La., December 5, 1946; graduated from Jonesboro-Hodge High School, Jonesboro, \r', 'La., 1964; graduated, University of Louisiana-Monroe, Monroe, La.; United \r', 'States Air Force reserve, 1965-1971; insurance agent; businessman; member of \r', 'the Louisiana state house of representatives, 1987-2002; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Eighth Congress; changed from a Democrat to a Republican on \r', 'August 9, 2004; reelected as a Republican to the One Hundred Ninth and to the \r', 'four succeeding Congresses until his resignation on September 27, 2013 (January \r', '3, 2003- September 27, 2013).\r']

Name: ALTMIRE, Jason
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Kittanning, Armstrong \r', 'County, Pa., March 7, 1968; B.S., Florida State University, Tallahassee, Fla., \r', '1990; M.H.S.A., George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1998; staff, \r', 'United States Representative Pete Peterson of Florida, 1991-1996; professional \r', 'advocate; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: ANDREWS, Robert Ernest
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Camden, Camden County, \r', 'N.J., August 4, 1957; graduated from Triton High School, Runnemede, N.J., 1975; \r', 'B.S., Bucknell University, Lewisburg, Pa., 1979; J.D., Cornell Law School, \r', 'Ithaca, N.Y., 1982; freeholder, Camden County, N.J., 1986-1990; freeholder \r', 'director, Camden County, N.J., 1988-1990; elected as a Democrat by special \r', 'election to the One Hundred First Congress, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative James Florio and reelected to the \r', 'twelve succeeding Congresses until his resignation on February 18, 2014 (November 6, 1990-February 18, 2014).\r']

Name: ARCURI, Michael
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Utica, Oneida County, N.Y., \r', 'June 11, 1959; graduated from T.R. Proctor High School, Utica, N.Y.; B.A., \r', 'State University of New York, Albany, N.Y., 1981; J.D., New York Law School, \r', 'New York, N.Y., 1984; lawyer, private practice; college instructor; Oneida \r', 'County, N.Y., district attorney, 1994-2006; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Tenth Congress and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January \r', '3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: AUSTRIA, Steve
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, \r', 'Ohio, October 12, 1958; graduated from Carroll High School, Riverside, Ohio, \r', '1977; B.A., Marquette University, Milwaukee, Wis., 1982; financial advisor; \r', 'member, Ohio state house of representatives, 1999-2000; member, Ohio state \r', 'senate, 2001-2008, majority whip, 2005-2008; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Eleventh and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, \r', '2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: BACA, Joe
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Belen, Valencia County, \r', 'N.Mex., January 23, 1947; B.A., California State University, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1971; United States Army, 1966-1968; member of the California state \r', 'assembly, 1992-1999; member of the California state senate, 1999; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative George E. Brown, \r', 'and reelected to the six succeeding Congresses (November 16, 1999-January 3, \r', '2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congress in 2012; unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth Congress in 2014; unsuccessful candidate for election as Mayor of \r', 'Fontana, Calif., in 2014; unsuccessful candidate for nomination as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Joe Baca” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: BACHMANN, Michele
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Waterloo, Black Hawk \r', 'County, Iowa, April 6, 1956; graduated from Anoka High School, Anoka, Minn., \r', '1974; B.A., Winona State University, Winona, Minn., 1978; J.D., Coburn School \r', 'of Law, Oral Roberts University, Tulsa, Okla., 1986; L.L.M., College of William \r', 'and Mary, Williamsburg, Va., 1988; lawyer, private practice; attorney, United \r', 'States Department of the Treasury; member of the Minnesota state senate, \r', '2001-2006; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth and to the three \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014.\r']

Name: BACHUS, Spencer T., III
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Birmingham, Jefferson County, \r', 'Ala., December 28, 1947; B.A., Auburn University, Auburn, Ala., 1969; J.D., \r', 'University of Alabama School of Law, Tuscaloosa, Ala., 1972; National Guard, \r', '1969-1971; lawyer, private practice; member of the Alabama state senate, \r', '1983-1984; member of the Alabama state house of representatives, 1984-1987; \r', 'member, Alabama state board of education, 1987-1991; chairman, Alabama \r', 'Republican executive committee, 1991-1992; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, \r', '2015); chair, Committee on Financial Services (One Hundred Twelfth Congress); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: BAIRD, Brian
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Chama, Rio Arriba County, \r', 'N.Mex., March 7, 1956; B.S., University of Utah, Provo, Utah, 1977; M.S., \r', 'University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyo., 1980; Ph.D., University of Wyoming, \r', 'Laramie, Wyo., 1984; clinical psychologist; professor, Pacific Lutheran \r', 'University, Tacoma, Wash., 1986-1998; unsuccessful candidate for election to \r', 'the One Hundred Fifth Congress in 1996; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Sixth Congress and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BALDWIN, Tammy
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Madison, Dane \r', 'County, Wis., February 11, 1962; graduated from Madison West High School, \r', 'Madison, Wis., 1980; A.B., Smith College, Northampton, Mass., 1984; J.D., \r', 'University of Wisconsin Law School, Madison, Wis., 1989; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; Dane County, Wis., board of supervisors, 1986-1994; member of the \r', 'Wisconsin state assembly, 1993-1999; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Sixth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2013); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the United States Senate in 2012 for the term ending \r', 'January 3, 2019; Democratic Conference secretary (2017-).\r']

Name: BARRETT, James Gresham
Bio: ['a Representative from South Carolina; born in Westminster, Oconee \r', 'County, S.C., February 14, 1961; graduated from Westminster High School, \r', 'Westminster, S.C., 1979; B.A., The Citadel, Charleston, S.C., 1983; United \r', 'States Army, 1983-1987; business owner; member of the South Carolina state \r', 'house of representatives, 1996-2002; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Eighth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-January 3, \r', '2011); not a candidate for reelection in 2010, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination for governor of South Carolina.\r']

Name: BARROW, John
Bio: [' a Representative from Georgia; born in Athens, Clarke County, Ga., \r', 'October 31, 1955; graduated from Clarke Central High School, Athens, Ga., 1973; \r', 'B.A., University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1976; J.D., Harvard University, \r', 'Cambridge, Mass., 1979; lawyer, private practice; Athens-Clarke, Georgia, \r', 'city-county commissioner, 1990-2004; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Ninth and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-January 3, 2015); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: BARTLETT, Roscoe Gardner
Bio: ['a Representative from Maryland; born in Moreland, Jefferson County, \r', 'Ky., June 3, 1926; B.S., Columbia Union College, Takoma Park, Md., 1947; M.S., \r', 'University of Maryland, College Park, Md., 1948; Ph.D., University of Maryland, \r', 'College Park, Md., 1952; faculty, University of Maryland, College Park, Md., \r', '1948-1952; faculty, Loma Linda School of Medicine, Loma Linda, Calif., \r', '1952-1954; assistant professor, Howard University Medical School, Washington, \r', 'D.C., 1954-1956; unsuccessful candidate for election to the Ninety-eighth \r', 'Congress in 1982; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: BARTON, Joe Linus
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Waco, McLennan County, Tex., \r', 'September 15, 1949; graduated from Waco High School, Waco, Tex., 1968; B.A., \r', 'Texas A&M University, College Station, Tex., 1972; M.S., Purdue University, \r', 'West Lafayette, Ind., 1973; business executive; White House Fellowship, served \r', 'as aide to Secretary of Energy James B. Edwards, 1981-1982; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to the sixteen succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1985-present); chair, Committee on Energy and Commerce (One Hundred \r', 'Eighth and One Hundred Ninth Congresses).\r']

Name: BEAN, Melissa L.
Bio:
['a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'January 22, 1962; graduated, Maine East High School, Park Ridge, Ill., 1980; \r', 'A.A., Oakton Community College, Des Plaines, Ill., 1982; B.A., Roosevelt \r', 'University, Chicago, Ill., 2002; consultant; businesswoman; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to the United States House of Representatives in 2002; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Ninth Congress and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for re-election to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Melissa Bean” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: BECERRA, Xavier
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Sacramento, Sacramento \r', 'County, Calif., January 26, 1958; B.A., Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., \r', '1980; J.D., Stanford University, Stanford., Calif., 1984; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; staff, California state senator Art Torres, 1986; deputy attorney \r', 'general, Office of the Attorney General, State of California, 1987-1990; member \r', 'of the California state assembly, 1990-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses until his resignation on \r', 'January 24, 2017 (January 3, 1993-January 24, 2017); chair, House Democratic \r', 'Caucus (One Hundred Thirteenth and One Hundred Fourteenth Congresses); attorney \r', 'general of California, 2017-present.\r']

Name: BERKLEY, Shelley
Bio: ['a Representative from Nevada; born Rochelle Levine in New York, \r', 'N.Y., January 20, 1951; graduated from Valley High School, Las Vegas, Nev.; \r', 'B.A., University of Nevada, Las Vegas, 1972; J.D., University of San Diego Law \r', 'School, San Diego, Calif., 1976; member, Nevada state assembly, 1983-1985; \r', 'member, Nevada University and Community College System Board of Regents, \r', '1990-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the six \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection in 2012, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the \r', 'United States Senate.\r']

Name: BERMAN, Howard Lawrence
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., April 15, 1941; graduated from Hamilton High School, Los \r', 'Angeles, Calif., 1959; B.A., University of California, Los Angeles, Calif., \r', '1962; LL.B., University of California School of Law, Los Angeles, Calif., 1965; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; VISTA volunteer, 1966-1967; member of the California \r', 'state assembly, 1973-1982; delegate, Democratic National Convention, 1968, \r', '1976, and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the fourteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on \r', 'Foreign Affairs (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012. \r']

Name: BERRY, Robert Marion
Bio: ['a Representative from Arkansas; born in Stuttgart, Arkansas County, \r', 'Ark., August 27, 1942; graduated from DeWitt High School, DeWitt, Ark.; B.S., \r', 'University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, 1965; farmer; Gillett, Ark., city \r', 'council, 1976-1980; Arkansas Soil and Water Conservation Commission, 1986-1994; \r', 'White House Domestic Policy Council, 1993-1996; special assistant to President \r', 'William Clinton for Agricultural Trade and Food Assistance, 1993-1996; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the six succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: BIGGERT, Judy Borg
Bio: [' a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'August 15, 1937; attended New Trier High School, Winnetka, Ill.; B.A., Stanford \r', 'University, Stanford, Calif., 1959; J.D., Northwestern University School of \r', 'Law, Evanston, Ill., 1963; clerk to Judge Luther M. Swygert, U.S. Court of \r', 'Appeals, 7th Circuit, 1963-1964; president, board of education, Hinsdale \r', 'Township High School district 86, Hinsdale Township, Ill., 1983-1986; member, \r', 'Illinois state house of representatives, 1993-1998; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Sixth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: BILBRAY, Brian P.
Bio: [' (cousin of James Hubert Bilbray), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Coronado, Calif., January \r', '28, 1951; graduated Mar Vista High School; attended South Western College; tax \r', 'consultant; city council; Imperial Beach, Calif., 1976-1978; mayor, Imperial \r', 'Beach, Calif., 1978-1985; San Diego County Board of Supervisors, 1985-1995; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the two succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2001); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Seventh Congress; elected as a Republican, by \r', 'special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United \r', 'States Representative Randall (Duke) Cunningham and reelected to the three \r', 'succeeding Congresses (June 6, 2006-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: BILIRAKIS, Gus
Bio: [' (son of Michael Bilirakis), \r', 'a Representative from Florida; born in Gainesville, Alachua County, \r', 'Fla., February 8, 1963; attended St. Petersburg Junior College, St. Petersburg, \r', 'Fla., 1981-1983; B.A., University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1986; J.D., \r', 'Stetson University, St. Petersburg, Fla., 1989; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'professor; member of the Florida state house of representatives, 1998-2006; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2007-present).\r']

Name: BISHOP, Robert (Rob)
Bio: ['a Representative from Utah; born in Kaysville, Utah, July 13, 1951; \r', 'B.A., University of Utah, Salt Lake City, Utah, 1974; teacher; professional \r', 'advocate; member of the Utah state house of representatives, 1979-1994, \r', 'speaker, 1992-1994; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to \r', 'the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-present); chairman, Committee \r', 'on Natural Resources (One Hundred Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth \r', 'Congresses).\r']

Name: BISHOP, Sanford Dixon, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Mobile, Mobile County, Ala., \r', 'February 4, 1947; graduated from Central High School, Mobile, Ala., 1964; B.A., \r', 'Morehouse College, Atlanta, Ga., 1968; J.D., Emory University, \r', 'Atlanta, Ga., 1971; lawyer, private practice; United States Army, 1969-1971; \r', 'member of the Georgia state house of representatives, 1977-1991; member of the \r', 'Georgia state senate, 1991-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third \r', 'and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present).\r']

Name: BISHOP, Timothy H.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Southampton, Suffolk County, \r', 'N.Y., June 1, 1950; graduated from Southampton High School, Southampton, N.Y., \r', '1968; A.B., Holy Cross College, Worcester, Mass., 1972; M.A., Long Island \r', 'University, Long Island, N.Y., 1981; administrator, Southampton College, \r', 'Southampton, N.Y., 1973-2002; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eighth \r', 'and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-January 3, 2015); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: BLACKBURN, Marsha
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Tennessee; born in Laurel, Jones County, Miss., June 6, 1952; graduated from Northeast Jones High School, Laurel, Miss.; B.S. Mississippi State University, Starkville, Miss., 1973; business owner; private advocate; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundred Third Congress in 1992; member of the Tennessee state senate, 1998-2002; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-January 3, 2019); was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in 2018 for the term ending January 3, 2025.  \r']

Name: BLUMENAUER, Earl
Bio: ['a Representative from Oregon; born in Portland, Multnomah County, \r', 'Oreg., August 16, 1948; graduated from Centennial High School, Portland, Oreg., \r', '1966; B.A., Lewis and Clark College, Portland, Oreg., 1970; J.D., Lewis and \r', 'Clark Law School, Portland, Oreg., 1976; assistant to the president of Portland \r', 'State University, Portland, Oreg., 1970-1977; member of the Oregon state house \r', 'of representatives, 1973-1978; member of the board of directors, Portland \r', 'Community College, 1975-1981; Multnomah County, Oreg., commissioner, 1978-1985; \r', 'Portland, Oreg., city commissioner, 1986-1996; served on the Governor’s \r', 'commission on higher education, 1990-1991; elected as a Democrat, by special \r', 'election, to the One Hundred Fourth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Ronald Lee Wyden, and reelected to \r', 'the eleven succeeding Congresses (May 21, 1996-present). \r']

Name: BLUNT, Roy
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Missouri; born in Niangua, \r', 'Webster County, Mo., January 10, 1950; graduated Southwest Baptist University, \r', 'Bolivar, Mo., B.A., 1970; graduated Missouri State University, Springfield, \r', 'Mo., M.A., 1972; high school history teacher; clerk and chief election officer, \r', 'Greene County, Mo. 1973-1984; Missouri state secretary of state 1984-1993; \r', 'president, Southwest Baptist University, Bolivar, Mo. 1993-1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the six succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); majority whip (One Hundred Eighth through \r', 'One Hundred Ninth Congresses); acting majority leader (One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congress, September 28, 2005-February 2, 2006); minority whip (One Hundred \r', 'Tenth Congress); was not a candidate for reelection to the House of \r', 'Representatives but was elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in \r', '2010; reelected in 2016  for the term ending January 3, 2023; vice-chair, Republican Conference \r', '(2012-); chair, Committee on Rules and Administration (One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress, One Hundred Fifteenth Congress [January 3, 2017-January 20, 2017]). \r']

Name: BOCCIERI, John A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Youngstown, Mahoning County, \r', 'Ohio, October 5, 1969; graduated from Ursuline High School, Youngstown, Ohio, \r', '1988; B.S., St. Bonaventure University, St. Bonaventure, N.Y., 1992; M.A., \r', 'Webster University, St. Louis, Mo., 1996; M.P.A., Webster University, St. \r', 'Louis, Mo., 1996; United States Air Force, 1994-1998; Ohio Air National Guard, \r', '1998-2000; Air Force Reserve, 2000-present; member, Ohio state house of \r', 'representatives, 2001-2007; member, Ohio state senate, 2007-2008; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, \r', '2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BOEHNER, John Andrew
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, November 17, 1949; graduated from Moeller High School, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1968; B.S., Xavier University, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1977; United States Navy, 1968; businessman; business executive; member of the Union Township, Ohio, board of trustees, 1981, and president, 1984; member of the Ohio state house of representatives, 1985-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the twelve succeeding Congresses, and served until his resignation on October 31, 2015 (January 3, 1991-October 31, 2015); House Republican Conference Chairman, 1995-1999; chair, Committee on Education and the Workforce (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred Ninth Congresses); majority leader (One Hundred Ninth Congress); minority leader (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congress); Speaker of the House (One Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred Fourteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: BONNER, Jr., Josiah Robins (Jo)
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Selma, Dallas County, Ala., \r', 'November 19, 1959; B.A., University of Alabama, 1982; attended University of \r', 'Alabama Law School; staff, United States Representative Sonny Callahan of \r', 'Alabama, 1985-2002; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to \r', 'the five succeeding Congresses until his resignation on August 2, 2013 (January \r', '3, 2003-August 2, 2013); chair, Committee on Ethics (One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress).\r']

Name: BONO, Mary
Bio: [' (wife of Sonny Bono and Connie Mack IV, daughter-in-law of Connie \r', 'Mack III, elected under the name Mary Bono Mack in the One Hundred Eleventh and \r', 'one succeeding Congress), \r', 'a Representative from California; born Mary Whitaker in Cleveland, \r', 'Cuyahoga County, Ohio, October 24, 1961; B.A., University of Southern \r', 'California, Los Angeles, Calif.; restaurant business manager; personal fitness \r', 'instructor; board of the Palm Springs, Calif., International Film Festival; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special election \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the death of her husband, United States \r', 'Representative Sonny Bono, reelected to the seven succeeding Congresses (April \r', '7, 1998-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: BOOZMAN, John
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Arkansas; born in Shreveport, \r', 'La., December 10, 1950; graduated from Northside High School, Fort Smith, Ark.; \r', 'attended the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, Ark., 1969-1972; graduated \r', 'Southern College of Optometry, 1977; optometrist; business owner; rancher; \r', 'member of the Rogers, Ark., school board; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Seventh Congress by special election to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Asa Hutchinson; reelected to the \r', 'four succeeding Congresses (November 20, 2001-January 3, 2011); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a \r', 'Republican to the United States Senate in 2010; reelected in 2016  for the term ending January 3, \r', '2023.\r']

Name: BOREN, Daniel David
Bio: [' (grandson of Lyle Boren and son of David Boren), \r', '(grandson of Lyle Boren and son of David Boren), a Representative \r', 'from Oklahoma; born in Shawnee, Pottawatomie County, Okla., August 2, 1973; \r', 'United States Capitol Page School, 1989; B.S., Texas Christian University, Fort \r', 'Worth, Tex., 1997; M.B.A., University of Oklahoma, 2001; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Wesley Watkins of Oklahoma; education administrator; bank \r', 'teller; aide, Oklahoma Corporation Commission; member of the Oklahoma state \r', 'house of representatives, 2002-2004; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Ninth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-January 3, 2013); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: BOSWELL, Leonard L.
Bio: ["a Representative from Iowa; born in Harrison County, Mo., January 10, 1934; graduated from Lamoni High School, Lamoni, Iowa, 1952; B.A., Graceland College, Lamoni, Iowa, 1969; United States Army, 1956-1976; farmer; board of directors of the local farmer's cooperative, 1979-1993, president for thirteen years; member of the Iowa state senate, 1984-1996, president, 1992-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012; died on August 17, 2018, in Des Moines, Iowa. \r"]

Name: BOUCHER, Frederick C.
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Washington County, Va., \r', 'August 1, 1946; graduated from Abingdon High School, Abingdon, Va., 1964; B.A., \r', 'Roanoke College, Salem, Va., 1968; J.D., University of Virginia School of Law, \r', 'Charlottesville, Va., 1971; lawyer, private practice; member of the Virginia \r', 'state senate, 1974-1983; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the \r', 'thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BOUSTANY, Charles W.
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana; born in New Orleans, Orleans \r', 'Parish, La., February 21, 1956; graduated Cathedral Carmel High School, \r', 'Lafayette, La.; B.S., University of Southwestern Louisiana, Lafayette, La., \r', '1978; M.D., Louisiana State University School of Medicine, New Orleans, La., \r', '1982; surgeon; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Ninth and to the five \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate.\r']

Name: BOYD, F. Allen, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Valdosta, Lowndes County, \r', 'Ga., June 6, 1945; graduated from Jefferson County High School, Monticello, \r', 'Fla., 1963; B.S., Florida State University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1969; United \r', 'States Army, 1969-1971; farmer; member of the Florida state house of \r', 'representatives, 1989-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and \r', 'to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r']

Name: BRADY, Kevin Patrick
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Vermillion, Clay County, S. \r', 'Dak., April 11, 1955; graduated from Rapid City Central High School, Rapid \r', 'City, S. Dak; B.A., University of South Dakota, Vermillion, S. Dak., 1990; \r', 'member of the Texas state house of representatives, 1990-1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-present); chair, Joint Economic Committee (One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress); chair, Committee on Ways & Means (One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses); chair, Joint Committee on \r', 'Taxation (One Hundred Fifteenth Congress).\r']

Name: BRADY, Robert A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, \r', 'Philadelphia County, Pa., April 7, 1945; graduated from St. Thomas More High \r', 'School, Philadelphia, Pa., 1963; union official; sergeant-at-arms, \r', 'Philadelphia, Pa., city council, 1975-1983; chairman, Philadelphia, Pa., \r', 'Democratic Party; member of the Pennsylvania Democratic state committee and \r', 'Democratic National Committee; member of the Pennsylvania turnpike commission, \r', '1991-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special \r', 'election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States \r', 'Representative Thomas Foglietta, and reelected to the ten succeeding Congresses \r', '(May 19, 1998-present);chair, Committee on House Administration (One Hundred \r', 'Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: BRALEY, Bruce
Bio: ['a Representative from Iowa; born in Grinnell, Poweshiek County, \r', 'Iowa, October 30, 1957; graduated from B.G.M. High School, Brooklyn, Iowa; \r', 'B.A., Iowa State University, 1980; J.D., University of Iowa, 1983; lawyer, \r', 'private practice; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the \r', 'three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2015); not a candidate \r', 'for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United \r', 'States Senate in 2014.\r']

Name: BRIGHT, Bobby Neal, Sr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Midland, Dale County, Ala., \r', 'July 21, 1952; graduated from Carroll High School, Ozark, Ala.; attended \r', 'Enterprise State Junior College, Enterprise, Ala., 1970-1972; B.A., Auburn \r', 'University, Auburn, Ala., 1975; M.S., Troy State University, Troy, Ala., 1977; \r', 'J.D., Faulkner University, Thomas Goode Jones School of Law, Montgomery, Ala., \r', '1982; lawyer, private practice; prison guard; mayor of Montgomery, Ala., \r', '1999-2008; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress (January \r', '3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BROUN, Paul C., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Atlanta, Fulton County, Ga., \r', 'May 14, 1946; graduated from Athens High School, Athens, Ga., 1963; United \r', 'States Marine Corps Reserve, 1964-1967; B.S., University of Georgia, Athens, \r', 'Ga., 1967; M.D., Medical College of Georgia, Augusta, Ga., 1971; physician; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth Congress, by special election, \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Charles \r', 'Norwood, and to the three succeeding Congresses (July 17, 2007-January 3, \r', '2015); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in \r', '2014; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016.\r']

Name: BROWN, Corrine
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Jacksonville, St. John \r', 'County, Fla., November 11, 1946; B.S., Florida Agricultural and Mechanical \r', 'University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1969; M.A., Florida Agricultural and Mechanical \r', 'University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1971; Ed.S., University of Florida, Gainesville, \r', 'Fla., 1974; faculty, University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., Edward Waters \r', 'College, Jacksonville, Fla., and Florida Community College, Jacksonville, Fla.; \r', 'member of the Florida state house of representatives, 1983-1993; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the eleven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-January 3, 2017); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: BROWN, Henry Edward, Jr.
Bio: [' a Representative from South Carolina; born in Bishopville, Lee \r', 'County, S.C., December 20, 1935; graduated from Berkeley High School, Moncks \r', 'Corner, S.C., 1953; attended Baptist College (now Charleston Southern \r', 'University), Charleston, S.C.; attended The Citadel, Charleston, S.C.; South \r', 'Carolina National Guard, 1953-1962; business executive; member of the South \r', 'Carolina state general assembly, 1985-2000; member of the Hanahan, S.C., city \r', 'council, 1996-2000; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to \r', 'the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2011); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BROWN-WAITE, Virginia (Ginny)
Bio:
['a Representative from Florida; born in Albany, Albany County, N.Y., \r', 'October 5, 1943; B.S., State University of New York, Albany, N.Y., 1976; M.S., \r', 'Russell Sage College, Troy, N.Y., 1984; legislative director, New York state \r', 'senate; Hernando County, Fla., commissioner, 1990-1992; member of the Florida \r', 'state senate, 1992-2002; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth \r', 'Congress and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-January 3, \r', '2011); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r', '

Name: BUCHANAN, Vernon G.
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born on May 8, 1951; B.B.A., Cleary \r', 'University, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1975; M.B.A., University of Detroit, Detroit, \r', 'Mich., 1986; Michigan Air National Guard, 1970-1976; businessman; campaign \r', 'staff; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth and to the five \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2007-present).\r']

Name: BURGESS, Michael C.
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Rochester, Olmsted County, \r', 'Minn., December 23, 1950; graduated from Selwyn College Preparatory School, \r', 'Denton, Tex., 1968; B.S., North Texas State University, Denton, Tex., 1972; \r', 'M.S., North Texas State University, Denton, Tex., 1976; M.D., University of \r', 'Texas Medical School, Houston, Tex., 1977; M.S., University of Texas, Dallas, \r', 'Tex., 2000; physician; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to \r', 'the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-present).\r']

Name: BURTON, Danny Lee
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Indianapolis, Marion County, \r', 'Ind., June 21, 1938; graduated from Shortridge High School, Indianapolis, Ind., \r', '1957; attended Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind., 1958; Cincinnati Bible \r', 'College, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1959-1960; United States Army and United States Army \r', 'reserve, 1957-1962; businessman; member of the Indiana state house of \r', 'representatives, 1967-1968 and 1977-1980; member of the Indiana state senate, \r', '1969-1970 and 1981-1982; unsuccessful candidate for the United States Congress \r', 'in 1970; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-eighth and to the fourteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on \r', 'Government Reform and Oversight (One Hundred Fifth Congress); chair, Committee \r', 'on Government Reform (One Hundred Sixth and One Hundred Seventh Congresses); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: BUTTERFIELD, George Kenneth, Jr. (G.K.)
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Wilson, Wilson County, \r', 'N.C., April 27, 1947; graduated from Charles H. Darden High School, Wilson, \r', 'N.C.; B.A., North Carolina Central University, Durham, N.C., 1971; J.D., North \r', 'Carolina Central University School of Law, 1974; United States Army, 1968-1970; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; North Carolina resident superior court judge, \r', '1989-2001; North Carolina special superior court judge, 2002-2004; justice of \r', 'the North Carolina state supreme court, 2001-2002; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Eighth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by \r', 'the resignation of United States Representative Frank Ballance, and reelected \r', 'to the seven succeeding Congresses (July 20, 2004-present).\r']

Name: BUYER, Stephen Earle
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Rensselaer, Jasper County, \r', 'Ind., November 26, 1958; graduated from North White High School, Monon, Ind., \r', '1976; B.S., The Citadel, Charlestown, S.C., 1980; J.D., Valparaiso University \r', 'School of Law, Valparaiso, Ind., 1984; lawyer, private practice; United States \r', 'Army, 1984-1987; United States Army Reserve, 1980-2010; Indiana state deputy \r', 'attorney general, 1987-1988; legal counsel for the 22nd Theater Army in \r', 'Operation Desert Shield and Desert Storm; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January \r', '3, 2011); one of the managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 \r', 'to conduct the impeachment proceedings of President William Jefferson Clinton; \r', 'chair, Committee on Veterans’ Affairs (One Hundred Ninth Congress); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r']

Name: CALVERT, Ken
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Corona, Riverside County, \r', 'Calif., June 8, 1953; graduated from Corona High School, Corona, Calif., 1971; \r', 'A.A., Chaffey College, Rancho Cucamonga, Calif., 1973; B.A., San Diego State \r', 'University, San Diego, Calif., 1975; restaurant manager; business owner; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the Ninety-eighth Congress in 1982; \r', 'chair, Riverside County, Calif., Republican Party, 1984-1988; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present). \r']

Name: CAMP, David Lee
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Midland, Midland County, Mich., July 9, 1953; graduated from Midland Dow High School, Midland, Mich., 1971; attended the University of Sussex, Brighton, England, 1973-1974; B.A., Albion College, Albion, Mich., 1975; J.D., University of San Diego School of Law, San Diego, Calif., 1978; member of the Midland County, Mich., board of canvassers; member of the Midland County, Mich., Republican executive committee; special assistant attorney general, Michigan state attorney general, 1980-1984; staff, United States Representative Bill Schuette of Michigan, 1984-1987; member of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1989-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth Congresses); chair, Joint Committee on Taxation (One Hundred Thirteenth Congress). \r']

Name: CAMPBELL, John (of California)
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., July 19, 1955; graduated from the Harvard School, North \r', 'Hollywood, Calif., 1973; B.A., University of California, Los Angeles, Calif.; \r', 'M.B.T., University of Southern California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1977; certified \r', 'public accountant; auto dealer; member of the California state assembly, \r', '2000-2004; member of the California state senate, 2004-2005; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Ninth Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Christopher \r', 'Cox, and reelected to the four succeeding Congresses (December 6, 2005-January \r', '3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress in 2014. \r']

Name: CANTOR, Eric
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Richmond, Henrico County, \r', 'Va., June 6, 1963; B.A., George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1985; \r', 'J.D., College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Va., 1988; M.S., Columbia \r', 'University, New York, N.Y., 1989; lawyer; small businessman; member of the \r', 'Virginia state house of delegates, 1992-2001; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Seventh and to the six succeeding Congresses until his resignation \r', 'on August 18, 2014 (January 3, 2001-August 18, 2014); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for renomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; minority whip \r', '(One Hundred Eleventh Congress); majority leader (One Hundred Twelfth and One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: CAO, Anh (Joseph)
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana; born in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam; \r', 'March 13, 1967; graduated from Jersey Village High School; B.S., Baylor \r', 'University, Waco, Tex., 1990; M.A. Fordham University, Bronx, N.Y., 1995; J.D., \r', 'Loyola University, New Orleans, La., 2000; teacher; professional advocate; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; unsuccessful candidate for election to the Louisiana \r', 'state house of representatives in 2007; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Eleventh Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in \r', '2016.\r']

Name: CAPITO, Shelley Moore
Bio: [' (daughter of Arch Alfred Moore, Jr.), \r', 'a Senator and a Representative from West Virginia; born in Glendale, \r', 'Marshall County, W.Va., November 26, 1953; B.S., Duke University, Durham, N.C., \r', '1975; M.Ed., University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va., 1976; college \r', 'counselor; member, West Virginia state house of representatives, 1997-2001; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican to \r', 'the United States Senate in 2014 for the term ending January 3, \r', '2021.\r']

Name: CAPPS, Lois
Bio: [' (wife of Walter Capps), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Ladysmith, Rusk County, \r', 'Wis., January 10, 1938; graduated from Flathead County High School, Kalispell, \r', 'Mont., 1955; B.S., Pacific Lutheran University, Tacoma, Wash., 1959; M.A., Yale \r', 'University, New Haven, Conn., 1964; M.A., University of California, Santa \r', 'Barbara, Calif., 1990; nursing instructor; nurse administrator, Yale Hospital, \r', 'New Haven, Conn.; director, Teenage Pregnancy and Parenting Project and the \r', 'Parent and Child Enrichment Center, Santa Barbara County, Calif.; instructor, \r', 'Santa Barbara City College, Santa Barbara, Calif.; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by \r', 'the death of her husband, United States Representative Walter Capps, and \r', 'reelected to the nine succeeding Congresses (March 10, 1998-January 3, 2017); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in \r', '2016.\r']

Name: CAPUANO, Michael Everett
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Somerville, Middlesex \r', 'County, Mass., January 9, 1952; graduated from Somerville High School, \r', 'Somerville, Mass., 1969; A.B., Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., 1973; J.D., \r', 'Boston College, Chestnut Hill, Mass., 1977; lawyer, private practice; chief \r', 'legal counsel, joint committee on taxation, Massachusetts state legislature, \r', '1978-1984; alderman, Somerville, Mass., 1977-1979; alderman-at-large, \r', 'Somerville, Mass., 1985-1989; Mayor of Somerville, Mass., 1990-1998; Democratic \r', 'state committeeman, 1996; president, Massachusetts Municipal Association, 1998; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1999-present).\r']

Name: CARDOZA, Dennis A.
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Merced, Merced County, \r', 'Calif., March 31, 1959; B.A., University of Maryland, College Park, Md., 1982; \r', 'businessman; Atwater, Calif., city council, 1984-1987; member of the California \r', 'general assembly, 1996-2002; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eighth \r', 'and to the four succeeding Congresses until his resignation on August 15, 2012 \r', '(January 3, 2003-August 15, 2012).\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Name: CARNAHAN, Russ
Bio: [' (son of Senator Jean Carnahan, grandson of Representative Albert \r', 'Carnahan), \r', 'a Representative from Missouri; born in Columbia, Boone County, Mo., \r', 'July 10, 1958; B.A., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., 1979; J.D., \r', 'University of Missouri School of Law, Columbia, Mo., 1983; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election the United States House of Representatives in 1990; \r', 'member, Missouri state house of representatives, 2000-2004; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Ninth and to the three succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2005-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the \r', 'One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: CARNEY, Chris
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Cedar Rapids, Linn \r', 'County, Iowa, March 2, 1959; B.S.S., Cornell College, Mount Vernon, Iowa, 1981; \r', 'M.A., University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyo., 1983; Ph.D., University of \r', 'Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr.,1993; United States Navy Reserve, 1995 to present; \r', 'professor; intelligence analyst; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth \r', 'and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r']

Name: CARSON, André
Bio: [' (grandson of Julia Carson), \r', ' a Representative from Indiana; born in Indianapolis, Marion County, \r', 'Ind., October 16, 1974; graduated from Arsenal Technical High School, \r', 'Indianapolis, Ind.; B.A., Concordia University Wisconsin, Mequon, Wis., 2003; \r', 'M.S., Indiana Wesleyan University, Marion, Ind., 2005; marketing \r', 'representative; state alcohol license compliance officer; member of the \r', 'Indianapolis/Marion city-county council, 2007-2008; elected as a Democrat to \r', 'the One Hundred Tenth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused \r', 'by the death of United States Representative Julia Carson, and reelected to the \r', 'five succeeding Congresses (March 11, 2008-present).\r']

Name: CARTER, John R.
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Houston, Harris County, Tex., \r', 'November 6, 1941; graduated from Bellaire High School, Houston, Tex., 1960; \r', 'B.A., Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Tex., 1964; J.D., University of Texas Law \r', 'School, Austin, Tex., 1969; lawyer, private practice; judge, District Court of \r', 'Williamson County, Tex., 1982-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Eighth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2003-present).\r']

Name: CASSIDY, Bill
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Louisiana; born in Highland \r', 'Park, Lake County, Ill., September 28, 1957; B.S., Louisiana State University, \r', 'Baton Rouge, La., 1979; M.D., Louisiana State University Medical School, New \r', 'Orleans, La., 1983; physician; member of the Louisiana state senate, 2006-2008; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eleventh and to the two succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican to \r', 'the United States Senate in 2014 for the term ending January 3, \r', '2021.\r']

Name: CASTLE, Michael Newbold
Bio: ['a Representative from Delaware; born in Wilmington, New Castle \r', 'County, Del., July 2, 1939; graduate of Tower Hill School, Wilmington, Del., \r', '1957; B.S., Hamilton College, Clinton, N.Y., 1961; LL.B., Georgetown University \r', 'School of Law, Washington, D.C., 1964; lawyer, private practice; deputy \r', 'attorney general of Delaware, 1965-1966; member of the Delaware state house of \r', 'representatives, 1966-1967; member of the Delaware state senate, 1968-1976; \r', 'Lieutenant Governor of Delaware, 1981-1985; Governor of Delaware, 1985-1992; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the eight succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2011); not a candidate for relection in \r', '2010, but was an unsuccessful nominee to the United States Senate. \r']

Name: CASTOR, Kathy
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Miami, Miami-Dade County, \r', 'Fla., August 20, 1966; B.A., Emory University, Atlanta, Ga., 1988; J.D., \r', 'Florida State University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1991; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'member of the Hillsborough County (Fla.) board of commissioners, 2002 to 2006; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for election to the Florida state senate in 2000; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2007-present).\r']

Name: CHAFFETZ, Jason
Bio: ['a Representative from Utah; born in Los Gatos, Santa Clara County, \r', 'Calif., March 26, 1967; B.A., Brigham Young University, Provo, Utah, 1989; \r', 'business executive; chief of staff, Utah Governor John Huntsman, 2004; member \r', 'of the Utah Valley board of trustees, 2007-2008; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh and to the four succeeding Congresses until his resignation on June 30, 2017 (January 3, \r', '2009-June 30, 2017); chair, Committee on Oversight and Government Reform (One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: CHANDLER, A. B. (Ben)
Bio: [' (grandson of Albert Benjamin "Happy" Chandler), \r', 'a Representative from Kentucky; born in Versailles, Woodford County, \r', 'Ky., September 12, 1959; graduated from Woodford County High School; B.A., \r', 'University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky.; J.D., University of Kentucky, \r', 'Lexington, Ky.; lawyer, private practice; elected Kentucky state auditor, \r', '1991-1995; elected attorney general for the State of Kentucky, 1995-2003; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Kentucky in 2003; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in a special election to fill the vacancy \r', 'caused by the resignation of United States Representative Ernie Fletcher and \r', 'reelected to five succeeding Congresses (February 17, 2004-January 3, 2013); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: CHILDERS, Travis W.
Bio: ['a Representative from Mississippi; born in Booneville, Prentiss \r', 'County, Miss., March 29, 1958; graduated from Booneville High School, \r', 'Booneville, Miss., 1976; A.A., Northeast Junior College (now Northeast \r', 'Mississippi Community College), Booneville, Miss., 1978; B.A., University of \r', 'Mississippi, Oxford, Miss., 1980; real estate agent; Prentiss County \r', '(Mississippi) Chancery Clerk, 1991–2008; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Tenth Congress and to the succeeding Congress (May 13, 2008-January \r', '3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress in 2010; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States \r', 'Senate in 2014.\r']

Name: CHU, Judy

Name: CLARKE, Yvette Diane

Name: GIFFORDS, Gabrielle
Bio:
['a Representative from Arizona; born in Tucson, Pima County, Ariz., \r', 'June 8, 1970; graduated from University High School, Tucson, Ariz., 1988; B.A., \r', 'Scripps College, Claremont, Calif., 1993; M.R.P., Cornell University, Ithaca, \r', 'N.Y., 1996; William Fulbright Scholarship, Chihuahua, Mexico, 1996; \r', 'businesswoman; analyst; member of the Arizona state house of representatives, \r', '2001-2003; member of the Arizona state senate, 2003-2005; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Tenth Congress and to the two succeeding Congresses until \r', 'her resignation on January 25, 2012. (January 3, 2007-January 25, \r', '2012).\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Giffords, Gabrielle., Mark Kelly, and Jeffrey Zaslow. \r', 'Gabby: A Story of Courage and Hope. New York: Scribner, \r', '2011.\r']

Name: GILLIBRAND, Kirsten
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from New York; born in Albany, Albany County, N.Y., December 9, 1966; A.B., Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., 1988; J.D., University of California Los Angeles, Los Angeles, Calif., 1991; lawyer, private practice; special counsel, United States Housing and Urban Development; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth Congress and to the succeeding Congress, and served from January 3, 2007, to January 26, 2009, when she resigned to become a U.S. Senator; appointed January 23, 2009, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Hillary Clinton; appointment took effect upon her resignation from the House of Representatives on January 26, 2009; took the oath of office on January 27, 2009; elected in 2010 in a special election for the term ending January 3, 2013; reelected in 2012 for the term ending January 3, 2019. \r']

Name: Name
Bio: Bio

Name: GINGREY, Phil
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Augusta, Richmond County, \r', 'Ga., July 10, 1942; graduated from St. Thomas Aquinas High School, Augusta, \r', 'Ga., 1960; B.S., Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, Ga., 1965; M.D., \r', 'Medical College of Georgia, Augusta, Ga., 1969; physician; member of the \r', 'Marietta, Ga., board of education, 1993-1997; member of the Georgia state \r', 'senate, 1999-2002; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to the \r', 'five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in 2014.\r']

Name: GOODLATTE, Robert William
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Holyoke, Hampden County, \r', 'Mass., September 22, 1952; graduated from Classical High School, Springfield, \r', 'Mass., 1970; B.A., Bates College, Lewiston, Maine, 1974; J.D., Washington and \r', 'Lee University, Lexington, Va., 1977; lawyer, private practice; staff, United \r', 'States Representative M. Caldwell Butler of Virginia, 1977-1979; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present); one of the managers appointed by the House of \r', 'Representatives in 2009 to conduct the impeachment proceedings of Samuel B. \r', 'Kent, judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of \r', 'Texas; chair, Committee on Agriculture (One Hundred Eighth and One Hundred \r', 'Ninth Congresses); chair, Committee on the Judiciary (One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'through One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: GORDON, Barton Jennings
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Murfreesboro, Rutherford \r', 'County, Tenn., January 24, 1949; graduated from Central High School, \r', 'Murfreesboro, Tenn., 1967; B.S., Middle Tennessee State University, \r', 'Murfreesboro, Tenn., 1971; J.D., University of Tennessee College of Law, \r', 'Knoxville, Tenn., 1973; United States Army, 1971-1972; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; executive director, Tennessee state Democratic Party, 1979; chair, \r', 'Tennessee state Democratic Party, 1981-1983; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-ninth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1985-January \r', '3, 2011); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010; chair, Committee on Science and Technology (One Hundred Tenth and One \r', 'Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: GRANGER, Kay
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Greenville, Hunt County, Tex., \r', 'January 18, 1943; graduated from Eastern Hills High School, Fort Worth, Tex.; \r', 'B.S. Texas Wesleyan University, Fort Worth, Tex., 1965; teacher; business \r', 'owner; member of the Fort Worth, Tex., zoning commission, 1981-1989; member of \r', 'the Fort Worth, Tex., city council, 1989-1991; mayor of Fort Worth, Tex., \r', '1991-1995; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: GRAVES, Samuel
Bio: ['a Representative from Missouri; born in Tarkio, Atchison County, \r', 'Mo., November 7, 1963; graduated from Tarkio High School, Tarkio, Mo., 1982; \r', 'B.A., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., 1986; member of the Missouri state \r', 'house of representatives, 1992-1994; member of the Missouri state senate, \r', '1994-2000; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-present); chair, Committee on Small \r', 'Business (One Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congresses).\r']

Name: GRAVES, Tom
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in St. Petersburg, Pinellas \r', 'County, Fla., February 3, 1970; graduated from Cass High School, Cartersville, \r', 'Ga., 1988; B.B.A., University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1993; business owner; \r', 'member of the Georgia state house of representatives, 2003-2010; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress, by special election, to fill \r', 'the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative John \r', 'Nathan Deal, and to the four succeeding Congresses (June 8, \r', '2010-present).\r']

Name: GRAYSON, Alan
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in the Bronx, Bronx County, \r', 'N.Y., March 13, 1958; graduated from Bronx High School of Science, Bronx, N.Y.; \r', 'A.B., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1978; M.P.P., Harvard University, \r', 'Cambridge, Mass., 1983; J.D, Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1983; \r', 'assistant, U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, Washington, D.C.; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; businessman; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Thirteenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, \r', '2013-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congress in 2016, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to \r', 'the United States Senate.\r']

Name: GREEN, Al
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in New Orleans, Jefferson Parish, \r', 'La., September 1, 1947; attended Florida A&M University, Tallahassee, Fla., \r', '1966-1971; attended Tuskegee University, Tuskegee, Ala.; J.D., Texas Southern \r', 'University, Houston, Tex., 1974; lawyer, private practice; justice of the \r', 'peace, Harris County, Tex., 1977-2004; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Ninth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2005-present).\r']

Name: GREEN, Raymond Eugene (Gene)
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Houston, Harris County, Tex., \r', 'October 17, 1947; graduated from Jefferson Davis High School, Houston, Tex., \r', '1967; B.B.A., University of Houston, Houston, Tex., 1971; attended University \r', 'of Houston, Bates College of Law, Houston, Tex., 1973-1977; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; business executive; member of the Texas state house of \r', 'representatives, 1973-1985; member of the Texas state senate, 1985-1993; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-present); chair, Committee on Standards of Official \r', 'Conduct (One Hundred Tenth Congress).\r']

Name: GRIFFITH, Parker
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Shreveport, Caddo Parish, \r', 'La., August 6, 1942; attended Loyola University, Chicago, Ill., 1962-1964; \r', 'B.S., Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, La., 1966; M.D., Louisiana State \r', 'University, Baton Rouge, La., 1970; United States Army Reserve, 1970-1973; \r', 'teacher; physician; businessman; real estate developer; unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for mayor of Huntsville, Ala., in 2004; member, Alabama state senate, \r', '2006-2008; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress; changed \r', 'from the Democratic to Republican Party on December 22, 2009 (January 3, \r', '2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for nomination for One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010; unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Alabama in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: GRIJALVA, Raúl M.
Bio: ['a Representative from Arizona; born in Tucson, Pima County, Ariz., \r', 'February 19, 1948; graduated from Sunnyside High School, Tucson, Ariz.; B.A., \r', 'University of Arizona, Tucson, Ariz., 1986; member of the Tucson, Ariz., \r', 'Unified School Board, 1974-1986; Pima County, Ariz. supervisor, 1989-2002; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eighth and to the seven succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2003-present).\r']

Name: GUTHRIE, Brett
Bio: ['a Representative from Kentucky; born in Florence, Lauderdale County, \r', 'Ala., February 18, 1964; graduated from Bradshaw High School, Florence, Ala., \r', '1982; B.S., United States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y., 1987; M.P.P.M., \r', 'Yale University, New Haven, Conn., 1997; United States Army, 1987-1990; United \r', 'States Army Reserve, 1990-2002; business executive; member of the Kentucky \r', 'state senate, 1999-2008; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2009-present). \r']

Name: GUTIÉRREZ, Luis V.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'December 10, 1953; B.A., Northeastern Illinois University, DeKalb, Ill., 1974; \r', 'teacher; social worker, Illinois state department of children and family \r', 'services; administrative assistant, Chicago, Ill., mayor’s office \r', 'subcommittee on infrastructure, 1984-1985; co-founder, West Town-26th Ward \r', 'Independent Political Organization, 1985; alderman, Chicago, Ill., city \r', 'council, 1986-1993, president pro tem, 1989-1992; delegate, Democratic National \r', 'Committee, 1984; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present).\r']

Name: HALL, John
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Baltimore, Md., July 23, \r', '1948; graduated from Notre Dame High School, Elmira, N.Y.; attended Notre Dame \r', 'University, Notre Dame, Ind., 1964-1965; attended Loyola College, Baltimore, \r', 'Md., 1965-1966; musician; songwriter; business owner; member of the Ulster \r', 'County, N.Y. legislature, 1990-1991; Saugerties Central School District board \r', 'of education, Saugerties, N.Y., 1996-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Tenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2011); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r']

Name: HALL, Ralph Moody
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Fate, Rockwall County, Tex., \r', 'May 3, 1923; graduated from Rockwall High School, Rockwall, Tex.; attended \r', 'Texas Christian University, Fort Worth, Tex., 1943; attended University of \r', 'Texas, Austin, Tex., 1946-1947; LL.B., Southern Methodist University, Dallas, \r', 'Tex., 1951; United States Navy, 1942-1945; lawyer, private practice; business \r', 'executive; Rockwall County, Tex., judge, 1950-1962; member of the Texas state \r', 'senate, 1962-1972; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-seventh and to the \r', 'eleven succeeding Congresses; changed from a Democrat to a Republican on \r', 'January 5, 2004 (January 3, 1981-January 5, 2004); served as a Republican in \r', 'the One Hundred Eighth, and reelected to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 5, 2004-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to \r', 'the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Science, \r', 'Space, and Technology (One Hundred Twelfth Congress).\r']

Name: HALVORSON, Deborah L.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago Heights, Cook \r', 'County, Ill., March 1, 1958; A.G.S., Prairie State College, Chicago Heights, \r', 'Ill., 1998; B.A., Governors State University, University Park, Ill., 2001; \r', 'M.A., Governors State University, University Park, Ill., 2003; business owner; \r', 'manager; clerk, Crete Township, Ill., 1993-1996; member, Illinois state senate, \r', '1997-2008, majority leader, 2005-2008; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for the Democratic nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate in a special primary election for the Democratic \r', 'nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2013.\r']

Name: HARE, Phil
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Galesburg, Knox County, \r', 'Ill., February 21, 1949; graduated from Alleman High School, Rock Island, Ill., \r', '1967; attended Black Hawk Community College, Moline, Ill., 1967-1968; United \r', 'States Army Reserve, 1969-1975; factory worker, 1969-1982; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Lane Evans of Illinois, 1983-2006; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Tenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, \r', '2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: HARMAN, Jane L.
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in New York, N.Y., June 28, \r', '1945; graduated from University High School, Los Angeles, Calif., 1962; B.A., \r', 'Smith College, Northampton, Mass., 1966, J.D., Harvard University School of \r', 'Law, Cambridge, Mass., 1969; staff for United States Senator John V. Tunney of \r', 'California, 1972-1973; adjunct professor, Georgetown University Law Center, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1974-1975; chief counsel and staff director, United States \r', 'Senate Judiciary subcommittee on constitutional rights, 1975-1977; deputy \r', 'secretary to the cabinet, The White House, 1977-1978; special counsel, \r', 'Department of Defense, 1979; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and \r', 'to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 1999); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to One Hundred Sixth Congress in 1998, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination as governor of California; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding Congresses until \r', 'her resignation on February 28, 2011 (January 3, 2001-February 28, \r', '2011).\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Name: HARPER, Gregg
Bio: ['a Representative from Mississippi; born in Jackson, Hinds County, \r', 'Miss., June 1, 1956; graduated from Pearl High School, Pearl, Miss., 1974; \r', 'B.S., Mississippi College, Clinton, Miss., 1978; J.D., University of \r', 'Mississippi, Oxford, Miss., 1981; lawyer, private practice; prosecutor, \r', 'Brandon, Miss.; prosecutor, Richland, Miss.; chairman, Rankin County, Miss. \r', 'Republican Party, 2000-2007; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2009-present); \r', 'chair, Joint Committee on the Library of Congress (One Hundred Thirteenth and \r', 'One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses); chair, Joint Committee on Printing (One \r', 'Hundred Fourteenth Congress); chair, Committee on House Administration (One \r', 'Hundred Fifteenth Congress).\r']

Name: HASTINGS, Alcee Lamar
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Altamonte Springs, Seminole \r', 'County, Fla., September 5, 1936; graduated Crooms Academy, Sanford, Fla, 1953; \r', 'B.A., Fisk University, Nashville, Tenn., 1958; attended Howard University \r', 'School of Law, Washington, D.C., 1958-1960; J.D., Florida Agricultural and \r', 'Mechanical University, Tallahassee, 1963; lawyer, private practice; Broward \r', 'County, Fla., circuit court judge, 1977-1979; United States district judge for \r', 'the Southern District of Florida, 1979-1989; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1993-present). \r']

Name: HASTINGS, Richard Norman (Doc)

Name: HEINRICH, Martin
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from New Mexico; born in Fallon, \r', 'Churchill County, Nev.; October 17, 1971; B. S., University of Missouri, \r', 'Columbia, Mo., 1995; attended University of New Mexico, Albuquerque, N. Mex., \r', '2001-2002; engineer; business owner; member, Albuquerque, N. Mex., city \r', 'council, 2003-2007; president, Albuquerque, N. Mex., city council, 2005-2006; \r', 'trustee, New Mexico state natural resources, 2006; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, \r', '2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but \r', 'was elected as a Democrat to the United States Senate in 2012 for the term \r', 'ending January 3, 2019.\r']

Name: HELLER, Dean
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Nevada; born in Castro Valley, \r', 'Alameda County, Calif., May 10, 1960; graduated from Carson High School, Carson \r', 'City, Nev.; B.S., University of Southern California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1985; \r', 'member of the Nevada state assembly 1990-1994; Nevada secretary of state \r', '1995-2007; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses, and served from January 3, 2007, to May 9, 2011, when he \r', 'resigned to become a U.S. senator; appointed May 3, 2011, to the United States \r', 'Senate for the term ending January 3, 2013, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of John E. Ensign; took the oath of office on May 9, 2011; \r', 'subsequently elected in 2012 for the term ending January 3, 2019.\r']

Name: HENSARLING, Jeb
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Stephenville, Erath County, Tex., May 29, 1957; B.A., Texas A&M University, College Station, Tex., 1979; J.D., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1982; lawyer, private practice; staff, United States Senator William Philip (Phil) Gramm of Texas, 1985-1989; business executive; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2003-present); chair, House Republican Conference (One Hundred Twelfth Congress); chair, Committee on Financial Services (One Hundred Thirteenth through One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: HERGER, Walter William (Wally)

Name: HERSETH SANDLIN, Stephanie
Bio:
[' (wife of Max Sandlin), \r', 'a Representative from South Dakota; born near Houghton, S.Dak., \r', 'December 3, 1970; graduated from Groton High School, Groton, S.Dak.; B.A., \r', 'Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., 1993; J.D., Georgetown University Law \r', 'School, Washington, D.C., 1997; lawyer, private practice; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to One Hundred and Eighth Congress in 2002; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred and Eighth Congress, by special election, to fill \r', 'the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative William \r', 'Janklow, and re-elected to the three succeeding Congresses (June 1, \r', '2004-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r', '

Name: HILL, Baron P.
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Seymour, Jackson County, \r', 'Ind., June 23, 1953; attended Seymour High School, Seymour, Ind.; B.A., Furman \r', 'University, Greenville, S.C., 1975; member of the Indiana state house of \r', 'representatives, 1982-1990; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United \r', 'States Senate in 1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to \r', 'the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2005); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; elected as \r', 'a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, \r', '2007-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010; successful candidate for nomination to the United \r', 'States Senate in 2016, but withdrew following the primary.\r']

Name: HIMES, James A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Connecticut; born in Lima, Peru, July 5, 1966; \r', 'graduated from Hopewell Valley Central High School, Pennington, N.J.; A.B., \r', 'Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1988; M. Phil., Oxford University, \r', 'Oxford, England, 1990; banking executive; non-profit executive; member of the \r', 'Greenwich, Conn., housing authority, 2003-2006; chairman, 2003-2006; member of \r', 'the Greenwich, Conn., board of estimate and taxation, 2006-2007; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh and to the four succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2009-present).\r']

Name: HINCHEY, Maurice Dunlea
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York, N.Y., October 27, 1938; graduated from Saugerties High School, Saugerties, N.Y., 1956; B.S., State University of New York at New Paltz, New Paltz, N.Y., 1968, M.A., State University of New York at New Paltz, New Paltz, N.Y., 1970; United States Navy, 1956-1959; member of the New York state assembly, 1975-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012; died on November 22, 2017, in Saugerties, N.Y; interment in the grounds of the Maurice D. Hinchey Catskill Interpretive Center, Mt. Tremper, N.Y. \r']

Name: HINOJOSA, Rubén
