Name: HIRONO, Mazie
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Hawaii; born in Fukushima, \r', 'Japan, November 3, 1947; graduated from Kaimuki High School, Honolulu, Hawaii; \r', 'B.A., University of Hawaii, Manoa, Hawaii, 1970; J.D., Georgetown University, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1978; lawyer, private practice; member of the Hawaii state \r', 'house of representatives, 1981-1994; Hawaii lieutenant governor, 1994-2002; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the two succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'United States Senate in 2012 for the term ending January 3, 2019.\r']

Name: HODES, Paul
Bio: ['a Representative from New Hampshire; born in New York City, New York \r', 'County, N.Y., on March 21, 1951; A.B., Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., 1972; \r', 'J.D., Boston College, Chestnut Hill, Mass., 1978; assistant attorney general of \r', 'New Hampshire, 1979-1982; special prosecutor for the state of New Hampshire, \r', '1992; lawyer, private practice; professional entertainer; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to One Hundred and Ninth Congress in 2004; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth Congress and to the succeeding Congress \r', '(January 3, 2007-January 3, 2011); not a candidate for reelection, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate to the United States Senate in 2010. \r']

Name: HOEKSTRA, Peter
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Groningen, Netherlands, \r', 'October 30, 1953; graduated from Holland Christian High School, Holland, Mich.; \r', 'B.A., Hope College, Holland, Mich., 1975; M.B.A., University of Michigan, Ann \r', 'Arbor, Mich., 1977; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2011); chair, Permanent \r', 'Select Committee on Intelligence (One Hundred Eighth and One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congresses); not a candidate for reelection in 2010, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination for governor of Michigan; United States Ambassador to the Netherlands, 2017-present.\r']

Name: HOLDEN, Thomas Timothy (Tim)
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in St. Clair, Schuylkill \r', 'County, Pa., March 5, 1957; graduated from St. Clair Area High School, St. \r', 'Clair, Pa., 1975; attended Fork Union Military Academy and the University of \r', 'Richmond, Richmond, Va.; B.A., Bloomsburg State University, Bloomsburg, Pa., \r', '1980; Schuylkill County, Pa., probation officer; sergeant-at-arms, Pennsylvania \r', 'state house of representatives; sheriff of Schuylkill County, Pa., 1985-1993; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: HOLT, Rush
Bio: [' (son of Rush D. Holt), \r', '(son of Rush D. Holt), a Representative from New Jersey; born in \r', 'Weston, Lewis County, W. Va., October 15, 1948; graduated from the Landon \r', 'School, Bethesda, Md., 1966; B.A., Carleton College, Northfield, Minn., 1970; \r', 'M.S., New York University, New York, N.Y., 1974; Ph.D., New York University, \r', 'New York, N.Y., 1981; Congressional Science Fellow with United States House of \r', 'Representatives, Office of Representative Bob Edgar of Pennsylvania, 1982-1983; \r', 'faculty, Swarthmore College, Swarthmore, Pa., 1980-1988; acting chief, Nuclear \r', 'and Scientific Division, Office of Strategic Forces, United States Department \r', 'of State, 1987-1989; assistant director, Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory, \r', '1989-1997; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for nomination for the United States Senate in 2013.\r']

Name: HONDA, Mike
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Walnut Grove, Solano County, Calif., June 27, 1941; graduated from San Jose High School, San Jose, Calif., 1959; B.A., San Jose State University, San Jose, Calif., 1968; M.A., San Jose State University, San Jose, Calif., 1974; United States Peace Corps, 1965-1967; member of the San Jose, Calif., planning commission, 1971-1981; member of the San Jose, Calif., unified school board, 1981-1990; member of the Santa Clara County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1990-1996; member of the California state assembly, 1997-2000; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2017); was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: HOYER, Steny Hamilton
Bio: ['a Representative from Maryland; born in New York City, N.Y., June \r', '14, 1939; graduated from Suitland High School, Suitland, Md., 1957; B.S., \r', 'University of Maryland, College Park, 1963; J.D., Georgetown University Law \r', 'Center, Washington, D.C., 1966; lawyer, private practice; member of the \r', 'Maryland state senate, 1966-1979, and president, 1975-1979; member of the \r', 'Maryland state board for higher education, 1978-1981; delegate to Democratic \r', 'National Conventions, 1968, 1974, 1976, and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-seventh Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy created by H. \r', 'Res. 80, which declared United States Representative Gladys Noon Spellman’s \r', 'seat vacant due to an incapacitating illness, and reelected to the eighteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (May 19, 1981-present); chairman, House Democratic Caucus \r', '(One Hundred First through One Hundred Third Congresses); minority whip (One \r', 'Hundred Eighth, One Hundred Ninth, and One Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congresses); majority leader (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congresses). \r']

Name: HUNTER, Duncan Duane
Bio: [' (son of Duncan Lee Hunter), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in San Diego, San Diego \r', 'County, Calif., December 7, 1976; graduated from Granite Hills High School, El \r', 'Cajon, Calif.; B.S., San Diego State University, San Diego, Calif., 2001; \r', 'United States Marine Corps, 2002-2005; United States Marine Corps Reserve, \r', '2005-present; real estate developer; businessman; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Eleventh and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2009-present). \r']

Name: INGLIS, Robert Durden
Bio: ['a Representative from South Carolina; born in Savannah, Chatham \r', 'County, Ga., October 11, 1959; graduated from May River Academy, Bluffton, \r', 'S.C.; B.A., Duke University, Durham, N.C., 1981; J.D., University of Virginia, \r', 'Charlottesville, Va., 1984; lawyer, private practice; Greenville County \r', 'Republican Party, executive committee; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, \r', '1999); was not a candidate in 1998 for reelection to the U.S. House of \r', 'Representatives but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United \r', 'States Senate; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Ninth and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2005-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for nomination for One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: INSLEE, Jay Robert
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Seattle, King County, \r', 'Wash., February 9, 1951; graduated from Ingraham High School, Seattle, Wash., \r', '1969; attended Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1969-1970; B.A., \r', 'University of Washington, Seattle, Wash., 1972; J.D., Willamette University \r', 'School of Law, Salem, Oreg., 1976; lawyer, private practice; Selah, Wash., city \r', 'prosecutor, 1976-1984; member of the Washington state house of representatives, \r', '1988-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third Congress (January 3, \r', '1993-January 3, 1995); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth Congress in 1994; unsuccessful candidate for nomination as governor of \r', 'Washington in 1996; regional director, United States Department of Health and \r', 'Human Services, 1997-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth \r', 'Congress and to the six succeeding Congresses until his resignation on March \r', '20, 2012. (January 3, 1999-March 20, 2012); was not a candidate for reelection \r', 'to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012, but was elected governor of \r', 'Washington; Governor of Washington, 2013-present.\r']

Name: ISRAEL, Steve
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Brooklyn, Kings County, \r', 'N.Y., May 30, 1958; attended Nassau Community College, Garden City, N.Y., 1978; \r', 'attended Syracuse University, Syracuse, N.Y., 1978-1979; B.A., George \r', 'Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1982; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Richard Ottinger of New York, 1980-1983; member of the \r', 'Huntington, N.Y., town board, 1993-2001; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Seventh and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January \r', '3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth \r', 'Congress in 2016.\r']

Name: ISSA, Darrell
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Cleveland, Cuyahoga \r', 'County, Ohio, November 1, 1953; B.A., Siena Heights College, Adrian, Mich., \r', '1976; United States Army, 1970-1980; business owner; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2001-present); chairman, Committee on Oversight and Government Reform (One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: JACKSON, Jesse L., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Greenville, Pickens County, \r', 'S.C., March 11, 1965; B.S., North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State \r', 'University, Greensboro, N.C., 1987; M.A., Chicago Theological Seminary, \r', 'Chicago, Ill., 1989; J.D., University of Illinois College of Law, Chicago, \r', 'Ill., 1993; secretary, Democratic National Committee’s Black Caucus; national \r', 'field director, National Rainbow Coalition, 1993-1995; member, Rainbow/PUSH \r', 'Coalition; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth Congress, to fill \r', 'the vacancy created by the resignation of United States Representative Mel \r', 'Reynolds, reelected to the eight succeeding Congresses until his resignation on \r', 'November 21, 2012 (December 12, 1995-November 21, 2012); elected to the One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congress, but declined his seat.\r']

Name: JACKSON LEE, Sheila
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Queens, Queens County, N.Y., \r', 'January 12, 1950; graduated from Jamaica High School, Jamaica, N.Y.; B.A., Yale \r', 'University, New Haven, Conn., 1972; J.D., University of Virginia Law School, \r', 'Charlottesville, Va., 1975; lawyer, private practice; staff counsel, United \r', 'States House Select Committee on Assassinations, 1977-1978; member of the \r', 'Houston, Tex., city council, 1990-1994; Houston, Tex., municipal judge, \r', '1987-1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to the eleven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-present).\r']

Name: JENKINS, Lynn
Bio: ['a Representative from Kansas; born in Holton, Jackson County, Kans., \r', 'June 10, 1963; A.A., Kansas State University, Manhattan, Kans., 1985; B.S., \r', 'Weber State University, Ogden, Utah, 1985; accountant; member of the Kansas \r', 'state house of representatives, 1999-2001; member of the Kansas state senate, \r', '2001-2003; Kansas state treasurer, 2003-2008; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2009-present).\r']

Name: JOHNSON, Eddie Bernice
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Waco, McLennan County, Tex., \r', 'December 3, 1935; graduated from A.J. Moore High School, Waco, Tex., 1952; \r', 'nursing certificate, St. Mary’s College at the University of Notre Dame, \r', 'Notre Dame, Ind., 1955; B.S., Texas Christian University, Fort Worth, Tex., \r', '1967; M.P.A., Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Tex., 1976; chief \r', 'psychiatric nurse and psychotherapist, Veterans Administration hospital, \r', 'Dallas, Tex.; member of the Texas state house of representatives, 1972-1977; \r', 'administrator, United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare, \r', '1977-1981; business owner; member of the Texas state senate, 1986-1992; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present).\r']

Name: JOHNSON, Hank
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Washington, D.C., October 2, \r', '1954; B.A., Clark College (Clark Atlanta University), Atlanta, Ga., 1976; J.D., \r', 'Thurgood Marshall School of Law, Texas Southern University, Houston, Tex., \r', '1979; lawyer, private practice; member of the DeKalb County, Ga., board of commissioners, \r', '2001-2006; associate judge, DeKalb County, Ga., magistrate court, 1989-2001; \r', 'one of the managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 2009 to \r', 'conduct the impeachment proceedings of Samuel B. Kent, judge of the United \r', 'States District Court for the Southern District of Texas; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Tenth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2007-present).\r']

Name: Name
Bio: Bio

Name: JOHNSON, Sam
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, \r', 'Tex., October 11, 1930; graduated from Woodrow Wilson High School, Dallas, \r', 'Tex.; B.B.A., Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Tex., 1951; M.S.I.A., \r', 'George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1974; United States Air Force, \r', '1950-1979; prisoner of war during the Vietnam War, 1966-1973; decorated combat \r', 'veteran, received two Silver Stars, two Legions of Merit, the Distinguished \r', 'Flying Cross, one Bronze Star with Valor, two Purple Hearts, four Air Medals, \r', 'and three outstanding unit awards; member of the Texas state house of \r', 'representatives, 1985-1991; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second \r', 'Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of \r', 'United States Representative Harry Stephen (Steve) Bartlett, and reelected to \r', 'the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (May 8, \r', '1991-present). \r']

Name: JOHNSON, Timothy V.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Urbana, Champaign County, \r', 'Ill., July 23, 1946; graduated from Urbana High School, Urbana, Ill.; attended \r', 'United States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y., 1964; graduated from \r', 'University of Illinois, Champaign, Ill., 1969; J.D., University of Illinois, \r', 'Champaign, Ill., 1972; lawyer, private practice; realtor; member, Urbana, Ill., \r', 'city council, 1971-1975; member, Illinois state house of representatives, \r', '1976-2000; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: JONES, Walter Beaman, Jr.
Bio: [' (son of Walter Beaman Jones, Sr.), \r', 'a Representative from North Carolina; born in Farmville, Pitt \r', 'County, N.C., February 10, 1943; graduated from Hargrave Military Academy, \r', 'Chatham, Va., 1961; B.A., Atlantic Christian College (now Barton College), \r', 'Wilson, N.C., 1966; North Carolina National Guard, 1967-1971; member of the \r', 'North Carolina state house of representatives, 1983-1992; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Third Congress in 1992; elected as \r', 'a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the eleven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-present). \r']

Name: JORDAN, Jim
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Troy, Miami County, Ohio, \r', 'February 17, 1964; graduated from Graham High School, St. Paris, Ohio, 1982; \r', 'B.S., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1986; M.A., The Ohio State \r', 'University, Columbus, Ohio, 1991; J.D., Capital University, Columbus, Ohio, \r', '2001; lawyer, private practice; member of the Ohio state house of \r', 'representatives, 1995-2000; member of the Ohio state senate, 2001-2006; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2007-present).\r']

Name: KAGEN, Steven
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Appleton, Outagamie County, \r', 'Wis., December 12, 1949; attended Appleton East High School, Appleton, Wis., \r', 'B.S., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1972; M.D., University of \r', 'Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1976; physician; founder, Kagen Allergy Clinics; \r', 'professor, Medical College of Wisconsin, Milwaukee, Wis.; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Tenth Congress and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, \r', '2007-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: KANJORSKI, Paul E.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Nanticoke, Luzerne \r', 'County, Pa., April 2, 1937; United States Capitol Page School, Washington, \r', 'D.C., 1954; attended Wyoming Seminary, Kingston, Pa.; Temple University, \r', 'Philadelphia, Pa., 1957-1961; Dickinson School of Law, Carlisle, Pa., \r', '1962-1965; United States Army Reserves, 1960-1961; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'administrative law judge for workmen’s compensation, 1971-1980; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the Ninety-ninth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1985-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: KAPTUR, Marcia Carolyn (Marcy)
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Toledo, Lucas County, Ohio, June \r', '17, 1946; graduated from St. Ursula Academy, Toledo, Ohio, 1964; B.A., \r', 'University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1968; M.A., University of Michigan, Ann \r', 'Arbor, Mich., 1974; attended the University of Manchester, Manchester, England, \r', '1974; post-graduate studies, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, \r', 'Mass., 1981; urban planner, Toledo-Lucas County, Ohio, Plan Commissions, \r', '1969-1975; director of planning, National Center for Urban Ethnic Affairs, \r', '1975-1977; assistant director for urban affairs, domestic policy staff, \r', 'Executive Office of the President, 1977-1979; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-eighth and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1983-present).\r']

Name: KENNEDY, Patrick Joseph
Bio: [' (son of Edward Moore Kennedy, nephew of John Fitzgerald Kennedy and \r', 'Robert Francis Kennedy, cousin of Joseph Patrick Kennedy II, and great-grandson \r', 'of John Francis Fitzgerald), \r', 'a Representative from Rhode Island; born in Brighton, Middlesex \r', 'County, Mass., July 14, 1967; graduated Phillips Academy, Andover, Mass.; B.S., \r', 'Providence College, Providence, R.I., 1991; delegate to the Democratic National \r', 'Convention of 1988; member of the Rhode Island state house of representatives, \r', '1988-1994; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: KILDEE, Dale Edward
Bio: ['(uncle of Dan Kildee), a Representative from Michigan; born in Flint, Genesee County, Mich., September 16, 1929; graduated from St. Mary’s High School, Flint, Mich., 1947; B.A., Sacred Heart Seminary, Detroit, Mich., 1952; teacher’s certificate, University of Detroit, Detroit, Mich., 1955; graduate work, University of Peshawar, Pakistan, 1958-1959; M.A., University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1961; teacher; member, Michigan state house of representatives, 1965-1974; member, Michigan state senate, 1975-1976; delegate to Michigan state Democratic conventions, 1956-1977; delegate to Democratic National Conventions, 1968 and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: KILPATRICK, Carolyn Cheeks
Bio:
['a Representative from Michigan; born Carolyn Jean Cheeks in Detroit, \r', 'Wayne County, Mich., June 25, 1945; graduated from the High School of Commerce, \r', 'Detroit, Mich.; attended Ferris State University, Big Rapids, Mich., 1968-1970; \r', 'B.S., Western Michigan University, Kalamazoo, Mich., 1972; M.S., University of \r', 'Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1977; teacher; member of the Michigan state house \r', 'of representatives, 1979-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth \r', 'Congress and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, \r', '2011); unsuccessful candidate for nomination for One Hundred Twelfth Congress \r', 'in 2010. \r', '

Name: KILROY, Mary Jo
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, Ohio, April 30, 1949; B.A., Cleveland State University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1977; J.D., Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio, 1980; lawyer, private practice; Columbus (Ohio) board of education, 1992-1999; president, Columbus (Ohio) board of education, 1999; unsuccessful candidate for the Ohio state senate, 1996; Franklin County (Ohio) board of commissioners, 2001-2008; president, Franklin County (Ohio) board of commissioners, 2005-2007; unsuccessful candidate for the United States House of Representatives in 2006; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: KIND, Ron
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in La Crosse, La Crosse \r', 'County, Wis., March 16, 1963; B.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1985; \r', 'M.A., London School of Economics, London, England, 1986; J.D., University of \r', 'Minnesota School of Law, Minneapolis, Minn., 1990; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'state prosecutor, La Crosse County, Wis., district attorney’s office, \r', '1992-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: KING, Peter T.

Name: KING, Steve
Bio: ['a Representative from Iowa; born in Storm Lake, Buena Vista County, \r', 'Iowa, May 28, 1949; graduated from Denison Community High School, Denison, \r', 'Iowa; attended Northwest Missouri State University, Maryville, Mo., 1967-1970; \r', 'business owner; member of the Iowa state senate, 1996-2002; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to the seven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2003-present).\r']

Name: KINGSTON, Jack
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Bryan, Brazos County, Tex., \r', 'April 24, 1955; graduated from Clarke Central High School, Athens, Ga.; \r', 'attended Michigan State University, East Lansing, Mich., 1973-1974; A.B., \r', 'University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1978; business executive; member of the \r', 'Georgia state house of representatives, 1985-1993; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Third and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1993-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United \r', 'States Senate in 2014.\r']

Name: KIRK, Mark Steven
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Illinois; born in Champaign, \r', 'Champaign County, Ill., September 15, 1959; B.A., Cornell University, Ithaca, \r', 'N.Y., 1981; M.S., London School of Economics, London, England, 1982; J.D., \r', 'Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., 1992; United States Naval Reserves, \r', '1989 to present; lawyer, private practice; staff member for United States \r', 'Representative John Porter of Illinois, 1984-1990; special assistant, United \r', 'States Department of State, 1992-1993; staff member for United States House of \r', 'Representatives International Relations Committee, 1995; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the four succeeding Congresses, \r', 'and served from January 3, 2001, until his resignation on November 29, 2010; \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was \r', 'elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in the November 2, 2010, \r', 'special election to the term ending January 3, 2011, a seat previously held by \r', 'appointed Senator Roland Burris, and at the same time elected in the general \r', 'election for the six-year term ending January 3, 2017; took the oath of office \r', 'on November 29, 2010; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 2016. \r']

Name: KIRKPATRICK, Ann
Bio: ['a Representative from Arizona; born in McNary, Apache County, Ariz., \r', 'March 24, 1950; graduated from Blue Ridge High School; B.A., University of \r', 'Arizona, Tucson, Ariz., 1972; J.D., University of Arizona, Tucson, Ariz., 1979; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; Coconino County, Ariz., deputy attorney, 1980; \r', 'Sedona, Ariz., city attorney; member of the Arizona state house of \r', 'representatives, 2005-2007; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Thirteenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2013- \r', 'January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congress in 2016, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to \r', 'the United States Senate.\r']

Name: KISSELL, Larry
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Pinehurst, Moore \r', 'County, N.C., January 31, 1951; graduated from East Montgomery High School, \r', 'Biscoe, N.C., 1969; B.A., Wake Forest University, Winston-Salem, N.C., 1973; \r', 'teacher; businessman; unsuccessful candidate for the United States House of \r', 'Representatives in 2006; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eleventh and \r', 'to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2009-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: KLEIN, Ron

Name: KOSMAS, Suzanne M.

Name: OBEY, David Ross
Bio:
['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Okmulgee, Okmulgee County, Okla., October 3, 1938; graduated from Wausau High School, Wausau, Wis., 1956; B.S., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1960; M.A., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1962; real estate broker; member of the Wisconsin state assembly, 1963-1969; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-first Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Melvin R. \r', '

Casey (April 3, \r', '1976-January 3, 1977); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the \r', 'Ninety-fifth Congress in 1976; elected to the Ninety-sixth and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 1985); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the House of Representatives in 1984, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; author; unsuccessful \r', 'Libertarian Party candidate for election for President of the United States in \r', '1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for the Republican presidential nomination in 2008; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'the Republican presidential nomination in 2012; was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Bio:
['(father of Donald Payne, Jr.), a Representative from New Jersey; \r', 'born in Newark, Essex County, N.J., July 16, 1934; graduated from Barringer \r', 'High School, Newark, N.J., 1952; B.A., Seton Hall University, South Orange, \r', 'N.J., 1957; teacher; insurance executive; president, Young Men’s Christian \r', 'Association of the United States (YMCA), 1970-1973; member, Essex County, N.J., \r', 'board of chosen freeholders, 1972-1978; unsuccessful candidate for nomination \r', 'to the Ninety-seventh Congress in 1980; member of the Newark, N.J., Municipal \r', 'Council, 1982-1988; chairman, Essex county Democratic committee, 2003-2004; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundredth Congress in 1986; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the eleven succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1989-March 6, 2012); died on March 6, 2012, in \r', 'Livingston, N.J. \r', '

Name: PENCE, Mike

McKinney School of \r', 'Law, Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind., 1986; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election to the United States House of Representatives in 1988 and 1990; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); House Republican Conference Chair \r', '(One Hundred Eleventh Congress); was not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundredth Thirteenth Congress in 2012; Governor of Indiana, 2013-2017; elected \r', 'Vice President of the United States on the Republican ticket headed by Donald \r', 'Trump, and was inaugurated on January 20, 2017.\r']

Name: RANGEL, Charles B.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York, New York County, N.Y., June 11, 1930; attended DeWitt Clinton High School; B.S., New York University School of Commerce, New York, N.Y., 1957; LL.B. (J.D.), St. John’s Law School, Brooklyn, N.Y., 1960; United States Army, 1948-1952; lawyer, private practice; assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, 1963; counsel to speaker of the New York state assembly, 1965; counsel to the President’s Commission to Revise the Draft Laws, 1966; secretary, New York State Penal Law and Code Revision Commission; member of the New York state assembly, 1966-1970; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-second and to the twenty-two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1971-January 3, 2017); censured by the U.S. House of Representatives on December 2, 2010, for misuse of congressional letterhead and financial impropriety; was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016; chairman, Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control (Ninety-eighth through One Hundred Third Congresses); chairman, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); chairman, Joint Committee on Taxation (One Hundred Eleventh Congress). \r']

[' a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif, October 20, 1957; B.A., California Polytechnic University, \r', 'Pomona, Calif., 1979; M.A., University of Southern California, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1981; White House Office of Hispanic Affairs; analyst, Office of \r', 'Management and Budget; member of the Rio Hondo, Calif., Community College board \r', 'of trustees, 1985-1992; member of the California state assembly, 1992-1994; \r', 'member of the California state senate, 1994-2001; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Seventh and to the four succeeding Congresses until her resignation \r', 'on February 24, 2009 (January 3, 2001-February 24, 2009); Secretary of Labor in \r', 'the Cabinet of President Barack Obama, 2009-2013; member of the Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif. board of supervisors, 2014-present.\r', '
